prompt: In which cities has the Red Hat Summit previously been held? (65pts)
Name the members of the C-suite at Red Hat: (65pts)
What are the 6 Technical Decision Points? (40pts)
What are the 4 dimensions of Adoption Maturity? (20pts)
What are the 5 stages of a Matrix? (25pts)
The customer just advanced from level 2/Developer to level 3/Operational. What are the 4 actions we took that align to the 4 dimentions?
Your customer moved from level 2/Developing  to level 3/Operational . How did you MEASURE this?
Your customer moved from level 1/Initial  to level 2/Developing. How did you ASSESS this?,Limited usage across teams with early-stage

answers.text: The customer initiatives define KPIs and value is seen
Perception of value improving and concerns remain

prompt: Your customer moved from level 2/Developing  to level 3/Operational . How did you ADVANCE the customer to innovator?

answers.text: Adopt latest releases, evaluate emerging capabilities
Continuously optimize, contribute industry best practices
Invest in advanced training, develop expert-level skills across teams
Thought leadership, participate in industry events, open-source contributions

prompt: Name ways a customer's Container Management adoption maturity can be ASSESSED as level 3/Operational

answers.text: Applications are running in containers in production
OpenShift Platform Plus products (ACM, ACS) are being used
Teams have completed Red Hat training courses (DO280)
Internal teams cite container strategy as organizationally strategic

prompt: For the App Platform TDP, what are things we can do to improve customers PROFICIENCY from level 1/Initial to level 2/Developing?

answers.text: Red Hat training courses (DO188 and DO288)
Use Red Hat build tools for early production apps

prompt: What are steps that can be taken for a customer in the INITIAL stages of Virtualization adoption maturity?

answers.text: OpenShift Virtualization adoption workshop to identify use cases
Assessment of feature parity with customer's previous hypervisor (i.e. VMware vSphere)
Red Hat training courses (DO316 and DO280)
Launch engagement to migrate pilot VM workload
